💲Attention seniors and juniors! 💲
YouLeadIdaho, sponsored by Key Bank, Idaho Digital Learning, and Trailhead Boise and is an entrepreneurial challenge for high school seniors and juniors. Teams of up to five students will design a business and pitch it Shark Tank style to a panel of judges for up to $5,000 in scholarship monies. Not only is there an opportunity to earn a scholarship, students will enroll and complete a dual credit entrepreneur class through Boise State University, receive mentorship from business leaders throughout the valley, and network with leaders across the state.

The 2019 YouLeadIdaho winner was a Murtaugh High School, they created a app for farmers to buy and sell tractor parts, shortening the time tractors are out of service and saving farmers money.

To learn more about the competition and to see the results of the 2019 Melba team please take a moment to watch the video https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=_Ss0kXae5v8. Any student who is interested please stop by and visit with Ms. O’Sullivan for more information.

Melba Jr/Sr High School Parents and Guardians,

Lockers
If your student still has personal belongings in lockers, in the hall or in the locker rooms, those need to be cleaned out by June 3rd. A parent or adult can come to the school and we will help you retrieve those items. Starting June 1st, students will be able to enter the school to retrieve belongings. On June 3rd, all items still left in lockers, both in the hall and in locker rooms, will be removed and placed in a lost and found area until September.

Office hours
The Jr/Sr High School Office is open 8:00 to 4:00 Monday through Friday. It will close for the summer on June 3rd. The office will reopen on July 27th.

Please see attached letter for more information

GO MUSTANGS!

Eric Forsgren
Principal

Melba Jr & Sr High-

As we near the end of the school year, I imagine that many students need or want to retrieve belongings that might be at the school. We are more than happy to help with that. Office staff are at the school Monday through Thursday from 9:00 am to 3:00 pm. Although students cannot enter the building, adults can so we can let you in and help you retrieve your students things. Or, your student can contact us and come to the door and we will go get their belongings for them.

Many of you are wondering about graduation. We have been communicating with senior parents but I wanted to let everyone know about graduation. This year we will have a graduation parade. All graduating seniors will be lining Broadway Avenue in front of the school and you can drive by and see them and help to celebrate their accomplishments. The parade will start at 7:00 pm on Friday, May 22nd.-more info to come-You may drop off cards or anything else that you would like to the seniors at that time.

April 9 & 10th

Melba Elementary will hold kindergarten registration and screening on Thursday, April 9th from 4:30 pm to 8:00 pm and Friday, April 10th from 9:00 am to 2:30 pm.
